title: Fix confusion over whether `pass` is encrypted in `rclone config create`
body:
Hello and thanks for your time.

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
rclone can't use my app password for owncloud(webdav), the account password is working fine. I verified that the app password itself is usable by mounting the owncloud root with it.
`sudo mount -t davfs -o noexec https://owncloud.example.de/owncloud/remote.php/webdav /home/user/owncloud`
I creating the config always with this command:
`rclone config create MyProfile webdav url "$TARGET_URL" vendor owncloud user "$TARGET_USER" pass "$TARGET_PASSWORD"`

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Host Ubuntu 16 lts x64 but iam using docker and gitlab runner.
`docker run --rm --entrypoint=/bin/sh -it rclone/rclone:1.50.1`

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.50.1 & v1.50.1-036-g2784c323-beta
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.13.4
```

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Owncloud, webdav

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`rclone ls MyProfile:/`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
2019/11/13 20:26:28 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.50.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "-vv" "MyProfile:/"]
2019/11/13 20:26:28 DEBUG : Using config file from "/config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2019/11/13 20:26:34 ERROR : : error listing: couldn't list files: Username or password was incorrect, Username or password was incorrect, No 'Authorization: Bearer' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is mis-configured: Sabre\DAV\Exception\NotAuthenticated: 401 Unauthorized
2019/11/13 20:26:34 Failed to ls with 2 errors: last error was: couldn't list files: Username or password was incorrect, Username or password was incorrect, No 'Authorization: Bearer' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is mis-configured: Sabre\DAV\Exception\NotAuthenticated: 401 Unauthorized
```
